text: Damn hard bottle to open. Too hard if you ask me. This bottled Sake from a bottle shop poured a head of frothy fine to large sized white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a strong bubbly carbonation transparent clear colored body and an excellent lacing. The mild aroma was rice. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a bubbly fruity aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of rice mildly vinous crisp breads and fruity. Delicious and one I would certainly like to have again.

Bottle 300ml. [ As Marumoto Hana Hou Hou Shu ].Clear crystal clear water colored with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, herbs, sweet flower - hibiscus, sweet rice. Flavor is light heavy sweet with a long duration, sweet fruit, flower sweet, sweet rice. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. [20160318]

Looks Like pink champagne, taste like Kir, but more sparkling. Not bad, bit too sweet 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pink, clear, visible carbonation and a fading fluffy white head. Sticky, burnt rubber and sweet nose. Neat floral sweetness, sticky underbelly to a decent carbonation. Finish is grating sweetness.Bottle, Japan Centre Online, Sake Monday tasting
Bottle. Pink with white head. Aroma is quite earthy, yeast, fruity berries. Taste of apple juice, fruit cider. Quite sweet
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pink with a short-lived white head. Aromas of light fruit, mint. Taste is sweet, red fruit. Sweet finish.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear pink, nose is fruity, floral, pineapple, taste is sweet, herbal, fruity, floral.
bottle at home ... pink ... thin white lacing ... soft sweet rice nose ... soft fruit nose ... light sweet front .. light coconut .. bitter herbal limit ...
Pours a hazy very light yellow color with a white head. I get a lot of rose and hibiscus notes, with a lot of sweetness and sugar in the flavor. A sweet and fruity sake.

(300ml, courtesy of Mora2000)  Bill trying to find his feminine side with all the pink sake bottles.  Pours a hazy pale pink body with a small white head.  Aroma of florals, vanilla, rice, and rose hips.  Flavor of rice, vanilla, florals, and fruitiness.

Bottle courtesy Mora2000. Pours a cloudy peach color with a very fizzy white head. Aroma is rice, paper, light sweetness. Some alcohol on the nose. Flavor is dry, rice and sweet notes, with light sugar. Floral notes as well make it fairly light.

Bottle. Nose is roses, cream, and strawberries. Pours a strange hazy pink. Tarter than the normal Hou Hou, but still with a lot of sweetness. That same prickly and velvety mouthfeel is there, though. Good.
Cellars Sake Seminar.   Light pink color with a champagne-like head.  Light fruity aroma.  The taste is certainly raspberry, but more like a poor extract than real fruit.  Fairly sweet.

Pours with a fizzy, white head that lasts a bit. Decent lacing. Murky light pink body. Banana, rice and vanilla in the aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity with a strong dose of sweet rice. Creamy, fizzy mouthfeel. Quite different, and pretty good. Sent a photo to be uploaded.
